page.description: The Data Series Editor allows you to create Data Series before creating a control that uses the data in that data series; for example a list control or a button list control.

section.title: Data Source Type
section.description: The data source type menu determines what type of data the data series will be created from. The options are:

item.name: SQL
item.description: Uses SQL data to create a data series that can be used inside a control. You will need to build a connection to the SQL data to be used.

item.name: SQL -CrossSection
item.description: Uses SQL data to create a data series that used with different controls. "Cross sectional" means the data will be plotted from multiple fields in a single record.

item.name: Static
item.description: Create a list or table of static data by typing in the options to appear in the data series.

item.name: Javascript
item.description: Creates a data series based on Javascript, making the data accessible to Javascript functions in your component.

section.title: Using Cross Sectional SQL and DBF Types
section.description: Cross sectional data types allow you to plot data from multiple fields in a single record, rather than plotting data from a single field in multiple records. For more on this data type watch [this video on cross-sectional data]
